sourcesContent:
import { Container } from '../../style'; const CommunityCodeConduct = () => { return (

Here at Tagpros, we prioritize the well-being of our learners. We want to make sure that our community will be a safe space for everyone who uses our platform. Here are the guidelines that we wish everyone to observe to preserve a secure community. If you wish to report someone for violating these, please contact customercare@tagpros.us .

 

Teacher Code of Conduct

  • Appropriate background and expertise are required to teach a certain subject.
  • Always prepare for your classes and begin your classes on time
  • Model behavior that is appropriate for a student age 18 years or below
    • Do not teach a class while under the influence of drugs or alcohol.
    • Do not speak derogatory or foul words in class.
    • Treat everyone with respect
  • Communications within Tagpros should be kept professional
    • Respond promptly to questions of parents or students
    • Keep all communications within our platform. Read about{' '} Tagpros Communication Tools {' '} to see your options.
  • Classes should follow our Class Content Policies. Offer classes that are:
    • Secular
    • Objective
    • Age-appropriate
  • Abide by our policy on{' '} Safety and Privacy Policy for Teachers .

 

Parent Code of Conduct

  • Learners can only attend classes that they are enrolled in.
  • Keep open and respectful communication between you, the teacher, and fellow parents
    • Always clarify details regarding classes if needed
    • Always provide constructive feedback about the teacher’s performance and your student’s experience.
    • Communications with the teacher and other parents should be done with respect.
    • Try to inform the teacher and other parents if there are issues in the class.
  • Abide by our policy on{' '} Safeguarding the Community as Parents .

 

Learner Code of Conduct

  • Always be kind to your teacher and fellow students.
  • Ask questions to your teacher if there are clarifications before, during, or after class.
  • Avoid sharing personal information with others.
  • Learners are not allowed to send private messages to other learners on our platform.
  • Comply with the homework given by the teacher.
    • If the homework is too demanding, contact the teacher or tell your parents so that they can adjust the workload.
  • Treat everyone with respect.
  • Turn on your video camera at least once per session so that the teacher can verify your identity.

 

Tagpros Code of Conduct

  • We welcome members from all backgrounds, beliefs, and locations and are committed to creating a safe space for our users across all pillars of diversity.
  • We will listen to feedback from parents, teachers, and learners, and make changes accordingly.
  • We will create and enforce policies to create a high-quality, trusted, and safe community for learning. This may include removing content or users from the platform.
  • We will respond promptly to questions and issues that arise.

Finally, we ask that all members assume the best intentions in others. When something goes wrong, whether it's a technical glitch, an email without a response, or something else, we ask that you share feedback in a constructive way.

); }; export default CommunityCodeConduct;
